intro: Malvastrum americanum, commonly known as the American mallow, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. The plant is sometimes used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
